thread.title: Rodney Hood took 150 very excited kids to see the Lego Batman movie
thread.title_full: Rodney Hood took 150 very excited kids to see the Lego Batman movie

author: Kofie Yeboah
title: Rodney Hood took 150 very excited kids to see the Lego Batman movie
text:
Everything is awesome!
Who doesn’t love the movies?
Utah Jazz guard Rodney Hood decided to go see the Lego Batman Movie and took 150 kids from the Boys and Girls Club with him. 
Rodney Hood is treating 150 kids from the Boys & Girls Club to Lego Batman today! #DoingGood #BGCMovieDay pic.twitter.com/9tCvpJ4ZU1 
— Utah Jazz (@utahjazz) February 2, 2017 This is the coolest thing ever. Look how happy the kids look!
via Jazz | Twitter Look how happy Rodney Hood looks! I would love to hear Rodney’s thoughts on the movie. He can even have his own show and call it “Rodney’s Reviews” or something. 
It’s always cool to see athletes do stuff like this. Whether it’s taking kids to the movies, helping students with a creative writing workshop.
The #Pistons & @mifarmbureauins teamed up for a workshop with @Reggie_Jackson & @HenryEllenson13 . #NBACares 

https://t.co/7gEVHJ1aXY pic.twitter.com/SJY2q2i6Rx 
— Detroit Pistons (@DetroitPistons) January 27, 2017 To helping the community learn about things like bicycle safety ...
Earlier today Coach Spo joined SoFla Commuter Services and @myFDOT in educating HEAT Academy students on the importance of bicycle safety! pic.twitter.com/v2quWAiawx 
— Miami HEAT (@MiamiHEAT) January 31, 2017 And everything in between. This league is awesome.
